creator: seade@apache.org
text:
An option to disable timers should be provided to allow a script to be tested
without having to wait for all of the delays to occur.

creator: mstover1@apache.org
text: Is it not enought that the timer(s) can be disabled in the test plan?

creator: seade@apache.org
text:
Sure the timers can be disabled individually.  What I am suggesting is that
there be a way to remove the effect of all timers (a test might contain bunches
of them) with one setting.  IMO it is easier to work with the timers turned off
while the test script is being developed or maintained and then to turn them
back on again when the real-life tests are being executed.

creator: jmeter@binarytwo.com
text:
I get around this by having a Test-plan level variable for my timer's times and
then change that to '0' when I'm debugging/scripting a test. It works well
enough if you only have a small number of different timer values.

(That might be a solution that people can use until this is resolved in the UI...)
